> <OLD>
>
> Quickstride walks up to a higher hill, to see if he can spot an=
y activity
from long range, and notices that the jets are now flying in a t=
otally
different direction, incicating that their attentions have been put
=
elsewhere.
>
> "Rodimus, you're right, somethn' just caught those jet's att=
entions..
Whatever Tucson had up his manifold, looks like it's working. Sti=
ll, I dunno
if I'm ready ta let my guard down just yet."

<NEW>

OOC: If I =
understood things Quickstride was standing look out around the
Ark. If that=
 is the case then Quickstride is literally thousands of miles
from the batt=
le as it is on a different continent altogether. The battle is
in Europe wh=
ile the Ark is on the North American continent.

> <OLD>
>
> From the firin=
g range, Night Shift could see that Tucson's ploy was
working, as Straight =
Shot works in unisen with Kup. With the arrows fired,
Straight Shot gives K=
up the data he needs to make a direct hit, via using
her physical weaponry =
form, and her guidence systems. It was now up to Kup
to do the rest.
>
> "N=
ice firing Kup, it's working! I'll continue to download the trajectory
coor=
dinates to you, and hopefully we'll get those plane brains to focus on
some=
thing else other than the fortress."
>
> Night Shift nodds.
>
> "Looks good=
, they're buyn' it. I dunno if we should stay still though,
they could get =
a fix on us and then we're curtains. I vote we slowly change
our locations =
after a few shots, so that way we can confuse the living heck
outa their pr=
ocessors."
>
> From Tucson's vantage point, although unable to see what was=
 happening, he
keeps his com links open to his colleagues. And from what he=
 could surmise,
things were going according to plan. But yet he still had t=
o think of the
"What If's." There was always a chance that even a well thou=
ght out strategy
could go awry.
>
> "From what I hear,things appear to be g=
oing well. But we can not discount
the fact that events have a way of turni=
ng on us abruptly. Continue on your
paths, but be cautious."
>
> Rat Trap w=
ho was now with Windlord was happy to see that the jets were
being distract=
ed away from the fortress.
>
> "We copy that Wheels, okay Windlord, I think=
 we can make our move, the
distraction's working. I'll leave it up ta you t=
a find the best way in. You
know this place better than I do."
>
> Tucson n=
ow continues to move in slowly. He keeps to hidden areas on the
land with l=
ow vegitation, and travels by river beds, to be sure that his
tires do not =
kick up any dirt or rubble. His trailer keeps him from moving
too fast, as =
he tries to maneuver it through the terrain. That however did
not bother hi=
m in the least. He had never been one for speed, even in his
old SUV form. =
Things seemed rather familliar to him now, the way the
situation was playin=
g out, reminded him of older times, when Optimus Prime
would lead his Autob=
ots against the Decepticons and how careful he was with
his strategic skill=
s. And now, it was Tucson Prime's turn to roll in Optimus
Prime's tire trea=
ds. As Hydras was a cobination of Galvatron and Megatron,
Tucson Prime now =
comes to terms that Optimus Prime was now living within
himself and for all=
 intensive purposes, he is now the new Optimus Prime. He
now sends a messag=
e to all Autobots and Maximals.
>
> " Before I met up with all of you, my d=
irection was unclear. I thought
that I'd be fighting a losing battle by mys=
elf, and for a long time, it
seemed that way. But then, along my travels, I=
 met all of you, and you
brought me home, to the Ark, where you showed me w=
here Optimus Prime rests.
At first, I wished intensely that Optimus Prime c=
ould be brought back to
life, and I believed that for the longest time. The=
n, as I got to know all
of you, and realized the big picture of what was ha=
ppening, and then,
recieving the power of the Matrix of Leadership, I have =
now come to realize
that it's far better to look ahead at who is around you=
 now, and what is to
happen in the future than to dwell on that of the past=
. All of that would
not have been possible if I had not met all of you. And=
 for that I thank
each and every Autobot and Maximal for putting me on the =
right path. And
now, it's time for me to repay my debt to you all."
>
> He =
thinks for a moment.
>
> " As Optimus Prime stood firmly against Megatron a=
nd the Decepticon
Faction, I will firmly stand my ground against the Predac=
ons and
Decepticons. And by the end of this battle, we will show them that =
it's
unwise to underestimate our factions as they have done so up until now=
."
>
> He inches closser into his position.

<NEW>

The sweeps continue to =
close, their boosters flaring as they streak in,
momentarily showing up on =
thermal radar and then disappearing as they
shifted back to antigrav engine=
s.

The four remaining sweeps are now far more wary of attacks from Kup and=

Straight shot and use their aerial agility and superior speed to the best
=
advantage. The circle around laying down heavier and heavier fire as the
gr=
oup.

As Tuscon soliloquizes about his own state of affairs and how they af=
fect
his new status and thoughts, it is almost as if the sweeps can hear hi=
m, or
more then likely they can hear him talking into the radio. The Sweeps=
 are
said to be able to locate a single ameba in the vast oceans of a plane=
t,
locating a single voice in the cacophony of battle would present no prob=
lem.
Two of them peel off and begin to fire at Tuscon!

*          *       =
   *          *          *

Meanwhile as Windlord and Rat Trap approached a=
nd flew around they can see
the desolation around the tower. There is absol=
utely no vegetation around
the tower or within several miles of it. There i=
s only broken ground and a
large lake several miles across, filled with bub=
bling and broiling liquid
rock! Flight sensors show that the thermal updraf=
ts from the lake would make
the trip for Windlord difficult but not impossi=
ble.

The tower itself extends directly out of the magma itself and only th=
e fact
that it is crafted from some sort of Cybertronian enhanced metal tha=
t keeps
it from dropping into the same liquid state as the magma around it.=


Thermal sensors show that at its bottom, where the tower meets the magma,=
 it
is nearly the same temperature as the liquid stone, but evidently the t=
ower
has been sitting raised for quite some time because the top of it is m=
uch
cooler. While still extremely hot, it is possible that for a very limit=
ed
time someone may be able to crawl around the upper most section of the
t=
ower. However to deposit someone there would mean they would have to fly
ov=
er the large magma lake, and there is no cover of any sort, they would
almo=
st definitely be seen.

So far there has been no response from the tower it=
self.

OOC: The tower looks something like the telescoping tower that rose =
up out
of the ocean that the Decepticons used in the 80=92s cartoon.


(TAG=
)

Preston

><br>> " Before I met up with all=
